content.description: Start at the far left of the good ledge that makes up the whales mouth. Smear feet and traverse right using pockets and slopers on the right corner to top out. (Same top out as Sweet Mouth)
content.location: Begins on the obvious ledge at the far right of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start at the far left of the boulder using pockets for hands and low rails for feet. Traverse right on horizontal crack, then go up the vertical crack to top out.
content.location: Starts on the far left tapering end of the boulder.

content.description: Stand start in the middle of the juggy horizontal crack, left of the obvious vertical one. Go straight up to top out.
content.location: Starts in the middle of the left side of the boulder.

content.description: Stand start at the far left end of the large upper crack on slopers. Traverse right using sloping lip for hands. Top out at the vertical crack.
content.location: The Whale Boulder (Riverside Drive/Buttermilk trail) - From 42nd street parking lot, head left (west) on the trail following Riverside Drive (not over the foot bridge). The boulder will be just past the 2nd stream crossing on the left between the trail and Riverside Drive. It is right next to the trail with just enough room for a few pads that aren't in the way of the hikers and bikers.

content.description: Sit start at the far left of the boulder using pockets for hands and low rails for feet. Move straight up into the far left end of the large upper crack on slopers. Traverse right using sloping lip for hands. Top out at the vertical crack.
content.location: Starts on the far left tapering end of the boulder.

content.description: Start with hands on the low thin seam right of the vertical crack. Traverse right along the seam to the good ledge. Go straight up the bulging prow using tough sloping dishes and finish the difficult mantle. (Same top out as Short Nothings)
content.protection: At least 2 pads and a good spotter. More pads are encouraged.
content.location: Begins just right of the obvious vertical crack.

content.description: Start with hands on the low thin seam right of the vertical crack. Traverse right along the seam to the good ledge. At the good ledge finish right on good holds. (Same top out as Whales Mouth)
content.location: Begins just right of the obvious vertical crack.

content.description: Start at the good ledge that makes up the whales mouth. Go straight up the bulging prow using tough sloping dishes and finish the difficult mantle. (Same top out as Sweet Nothings)
content.protection: At least 2 pads and a good spotter.
content.location: Begins on the obvious ledge at the far right of the boulder.

content.description: Start with hands on the low thin seam right of the vertical crack. Go straight up to high crimps on small seam. Use the sloper and nearby pocket, then reach to a mono crystal and top out the slopey lip.
content.location: Begins just right of the obvious vertical crack.

content.description: Work your way up the center of the boulder starting on the side pull and undercling. Proceed directly up using side pulls, rail, and crack as would be done for Whale Crack.
content.location: Starts below the vertical crack to the right of Whale Blubber on the side pull and undercling. Same finish as Whale Crack.
